distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for go1.18 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-24675: Fixed a stack overlow in Decode() in encoding/pem (bsc#1198423).
- CVE-2022-28327: Fixed a crash due to refused oversized scalars in generic P-256 (bsc#1198424).
- CVE-2022-27536: Fixed a crash in Certificate.Verify in crypto/x509 (bsc#1198427).
    
Bump go1.18 (bsc#1193742)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: encoding/pem in Go before 1.17.9 and 1.18.x before 1.18.1 has a Decode stack overflow via a large amount of PEM data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Certificate.Verify in crypto/x509 in Go 1.18.x before 1.18.1 can be caused to panic on macOS when presented with certain malformed certificates. This allows a remote TLS server to cause a TLS client to panic.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The generic P-256 feature in crypto/elliptic in Go before 1.17.9 and 1.18.x before 1.18.1 allows a panic via long scalar input.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
